nodes.bodyText: why do we cache the AsyncResult<PreparedStatement> and not the PreparedStatement instead ?

nodes.bodyText: It behaves like it used to be. When one prepare statement request fails and the failure would be also cached.

nodes.bodyText: I wonder if we might want to improve this because caching failures such as syntax error, network failure, etc... does not help anything from the perspective of users.

nodes.bodyText:
ok, I didn't remember this part.
However then it does not map correctly to the max prepared statement cache size because this cache size should account for valid statements I think. So perhaps we want to remove failure caching.

nodes.bodyText: For now can we move this to the io.vertx.sqlclient.impl.codec package and rename to InvalidCachedStatementEvent because such detection could happen without the execution of a statement. Instead of the PreparedStatement just provide the statement identifier so it can be removed from the cache.
